content:
Yes, Apple's sales were impacted by the pandemic. During the initial phases of the pandemic, Apple was forced to close many of its retail stores and saw a decline in sales of certain products, such as iPhones. Additionally, the pandemic led to disruptions in Apple's supply chain, which impacted the production of some products. 

However, Apple's sales numbers have rebounded, thanks in part to strong demand for products like the iPhone and MacBook as consumers have adapted to remote work and online learning. Apple's revenue for the fourth quarter of 2020 was $64.7 billion, which was higher than expected and an increase from the same quarter in 2019. Overall, while the pandemic did impact Apple's sales initially, the company has been able to adjust and adapt to the changing circumstances.
